item.title: Bogura-6, Sherpur-3 by-polls likely on April 9
item.description: By-elections to two parliamentary constituencies – Bogura-6 and Sherpur-3 -- are likely to be held on April 09 next. The Election Commission is considering April 9 as the tentative date to hold by-elections in the two constituencies, an EC official said on Tuesday. He said the schedule for

item.title: President to pay tribute to BDR martyrs
item.description: President Mohammed Shahabuddin will pay tribute to martyred BDR (Now BGB) members at Banani military graveyard on Wednesday. The President will place a wreath at 10:00 am, marking the National Martyred Army Day, said a notification issued by the Protocol Wing of the President’s Office on Mon

item.title: Ministers visit victims of Ctg, Cumilla fire incidents
item.description: Health Minister Sardar Md Sakhawat Husain and Disaster Management and Relief Minister Asadul Habib Dulu visited the National Burn and Plastic Surgery Institute on Tuesday morning to see victims of Chattogram and Cumilla fire incidents. The ministers arrived at the institute in the morning where it

item.title: After AL’s fall, there were attempts at ‘counter-revolution’: President
item.description: President Md Shahabuddin has said there were attempts to stage a “counter-revolution” in the immediate aftermath of the July-August 2024 mass uprising that ended the Awami League’s decade-and-a-half rule. He also said he was subjected to intense pressure from different quarters t

item.title: PM chairs meeting on 'Family Card' at Secretariat
item.description: A meeting on the 'Family Card' was held on Tuesday with Prime Minister Tarique Rahman in the chair. The meeting was held in the conference room of the Cabinet Division in the Bangladesh Secretariat, reports BSS. Prime Minister's Additional Press Secretary Atikur Rahman Ruman confirmed the

item.title: Bangladesh govt orders strict adherence to office hours for public servants
item.description: The Cabinet Division has directed all officials and employees of government, semi-government and autonomous institutions to strictly follow prescribed office hours in a move to strengthen good governance. In a letter sent to senior secretaries and secretaries of all ministries and divisions, as we

item.title: DSE slips despite rise in DS30; CSE edges up on selective gains
item.description: Stocks witnessed mixed performance on Tuesday as key indices fell on the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) while the Chittagong Stock Exchange (CSE) closed marginally higher. At the DSE, the benchmark DSEX shed 10 points, while the Shariah-based DSES declined by 5 points. However, the blue-chip DS30 inde

item.title: Ali Hossain Fakir becomes new chief of Bangladesh Police
item.description: Additional Inspector General Ali Hossain Fakir has been named the new inspector general of police (IGP) amid an administrative shake-up after the new government took office. The Ministry of Home Affairs announced the decision in an order issued on Tuesday, bdnews24.com reports. Ali had been

item.title: Family Card to be launched in 14 upazilas on March 10
item.description: The government will initially introduce the ‘Family Card’ programme in 14 upazilas on March 10 to support marginal and low-income families. Prime Minister Tarique Rahman will inaugurate the programme, said his Additional Press Secretary Atikur Rahman Rumon. Under the initiative, he sa

item.title: Strict legal action against corruption in tribunal: Chief Prosecutor
item.description: Md Aminul Islam, the newly-appointed Chief Prosecutor of the International Crimes Tribunal (ICT), on Tuesday said strict legal action will be taken if anyone associated with the tribunal is found involved in corruption. He made the remarks while responding to questions from journalists at his offi

item.title: MP Arman meets governor over potential foreign investment in Nagad
item.description: Barrister Mir Ahmad Bin Quasem Arman, a Jamaat MP, met Bangladesh Bank Governor Ahsan H. Mansur on Tuesday at his office to discuss a potential foreign investment in the mobile financial service (MFS) provider, Nagad. The meeting was held as Bangladesh Bank sought to restructure Nagad after admini

item.title: EBL, POJF launch Sundarbans mangrove restoration initiative
item.description: Eastern Bank PLC (EBL) has partnered with Prokriti O Jibon Foundation (POJF) to support the Mangrove Restoration for Climate Resilience Project (MRCP) in the Sundarbans coastal belt, including Satkhira and nearby areas. The initiative will focus on large-scale mangrove restoration, community engag
